snippet: The agency had banned funding for these kinds of experiments last September, but is reconsidering allowing some under strict conditions....
abstract: National Institutes of Health announces plan to lift ban on funding for  research that involves injecting human stem cells in animal embryos; proposal will enter 30-day period in which public and researchers can submit comments on proposal; moratorium on funding was imposed to address ethics concerns about such research.
lead_paragraph: The agency had banned funding for these kinds of experiments last September, but is reconsidering allowing some under strict conditions.

headline.main: N.I.H. May Fund Human-Animal Stem Cell Research
headline.print_headline: Animals Grow Human Parts? Labs Hope So
